label: 大元師法
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: Also Daigenhō.↓The major Shingon rite concerning the pantheon figure Daigensui, one of the important Kings of Science" (myōō) of Japanese esotericism.  Because Daigensui was the commander in chief of all spirits and demons protecting the land, his cult developed with a focus on the protection of the state; it penetrated the court in China during the T'ang dynasty, and was introduced to Japan by Kūkai and his discpile Jōgyō (d. 866), where it became on of the most important national rituals kept in the highest degree of secrecy (p. 535-536). [真言、明王、空海、常暁] "
